text: Henry Ford (February 11, 1825?) was a Michigan politician. ==Early life== Ford was born on February 11, 1825 in Monroe, New York. ==Career== Ford moved to Michigan in 1867 to oversee the erection of the Lawton Iron Works. On November 2, 1880, Ford was elected to the Michigan Senate where he represented the 12th district from January 5, 1881 to December 31, 1882. ==Personal life== At some point in his life, Ford married a woman named Catherine. Together they had two children. Ford married Florence A. Smith on January 18, 1882 in Lawton, Michigan. ==References== Category:1825 births Category:Michigan state senators Category:People from Monroe, New York Category:People from Van Buren County, Michigan Category:Michigan Republicans Category:19th-century American politicians Category:Year of death missing
title: Henry Ford (Michigan legislator)
